DataElement.preferredName: Muscle Invasive Bladder Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to muscle Invasive Bladder Carcinoma as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Muscle Tissue Invasive Bladder Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Tissue responsible for the body movements and the shape and size changes of internal organs.  Muscle tissue is composed of specialized contractile cells.  There are two types of muscle tissue recognized: striated and smooth muscle.  The striated muscle tissue is further subdivided into skeletal, visceral striated, and cardiac muscle._Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue._A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Muscle Tissue; an animal tissue consisting predominantly of contractile cells.:Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue.:A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.

Concepts.definition: Tissue responsible for the body movements and the shape and size changes of internal organs.  Muscle tissue is composed of specialized contractile cells.  There are two types of muscle tissue recognized: striated and smooth muscle.  The striated muscle tissue is further subdivided into skeletal, visceral striated, and cardiac muscle.
Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released for TCGA per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 4/13/12

The non-affirmative response to a question.

A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have muscle-invasive disease that is tumor stage T2-T4, N0-1, based on TURBT performed within 8 weeks prior to enrollment?
